org.ros.actionlib.example
Class FibonacciActionSpec

java.lang.Object
  org.ros.actionlib.ActionSpec<org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciAction,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionFeedback,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionGoal,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionResult,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciFeedback,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciGoal,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciResult>
      org.ros.actionlib.example.FibonacciActionSpec

public class FibonacciActionSpec
extends ActionSpec<org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciAction,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionFeedback,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionGoal,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionResult,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciFeedback,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciGoal,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciResult>

The FibonacciActionSpec class represents the action specification for the Fibonacci action. It completely hides the Generics approach of the Actionlib implementation.

See Also:
ActionSpec

buildSimpleActionClient

public FibonacciSimpleActionClient buildSimpleActionClient(java.lang.String nameSpace)
Description copied from class: ActionSpec
Creates a SimpleActionClient using this ActionSpec and a given nodeName space. The SimpleActionClient gets parameterized to create a new thread to service the callbacks. This spares the users the effort to call spin() or spinOnce() themselves.

Overrides:
buildSimpleActionClient in class ActionSpec<org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciAction,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionFeedback,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionGoal,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionResult,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciFeedback,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciGoal,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciResult>
Parameters:
nameSpace - The nodeName space to communicate within (specified by the action server)
Returns:
A SimpleActionClient object

buildSimpleActionServer

public FibonacciSimpleActionServer buildSimpleActionServer(java.lang.String nameSpace,
                                                           SimpleActionServerCallbacks<org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionFeedback,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionGoal,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionResult,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciFeedback,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciGoal,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciResult> callbacks,
                                                           boolean useBlockingGoalCallback)
Description copied from class: ActionSpec
Creates a DefaultSimpleActionServer using this ActionSpec, a given nodeName space and a callback object intended to be used by the server. The useBlockingGoalCallback parameter specifies which callback method will be used on the reception of goal messages.

Overrides:
buildSimpleActionServer in class ActionSpec<org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciAction,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionFeedback,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionGoal,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciActionResult,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciFeedback,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciGoal,org.ros.message.actionlib_tutorials.FibonacciResult>
Parameters:
nameSpace - The nodeName space to communicate within
callbacks - A callback object providing callback methods, which get called by the server
useBlockingGoalCallback - A Flag, indicating whether the blocking or non-blocking callback method shall be used
Returns:
A DefaultSimpleActionServer object
See Also:
SimpleActionServerCallbacks#blockingGoalCallback(Message), SimpleActionServerCallbacks#goalCallback()
